lead_paragraph: Woonerf is roughly translated from the Dutch as “living streets.” It is a road that functions without traffic lights, stop signs, lane dividers or even sidewalks. The whole point is to encourage human interaction.
snippet: Woonerf is roughly translated from the Dutch as “living streets.” It is a road that functions without traffic lights, stop signs, lane dividers or even sidewalks. The whole point is to encourage human interaction....
abstract: Woonerf, Dutch term loosely translated as 'living streets,' applies to street or group of streets that function as shared public space, for pedestrians, cyclists, children and, in some cases, cautiously driven cars; cities and towns across globe have adopted model in various forms.

headline.main: Where ‘Share the Road’ Is Taken Literally
headline.seo: Where ‘Share the Road’ Is Taken Literally
headline.print_headline: Where ‘Share the Road’ Is Taken Literally
